GSD.description: ** DISPUTED *** Xen Mobile through 10.8.0 includes a service listening on port 5001 within its firewall that accepts unauthenticated input. If this service is supplied with raw serialised Java objects, it deserialises them back into Java objects in memory, giving rise to a remote code execution vulnerability.  NOTE: the vendor disputes that this is a vulnerability, stating it is "already mitigated by the internal firewall that limits access to configuration services to localhost."

descriptions.value: * Xen Mobile through 10.8.0 includes a service listening on port 5001 within its firewall that accepts unauthenticated input. If this service is supplied with raw serialised Java objects, it deserialises them back into Java objects in memory, giving rise to a remote code execution vulnerability.  NOTE: the vendor disputes that this is a vulnerability, stating it is "already mitigated by the internal firewall that limits access to configuration services to localhost.

** EN DISPUTA ** Xen Mobile hasta la versión 10.8.0 incluye un servicio en escucha en el puerto 5001 en su firewall que acepta entradas no autenticadas. Si el servicio se proporciona con objetos Java serializados en bruto, los vuelve a deserializar en objetos Java en la memoria, lo que provoca una vulnerabilidad de ejecución remota de código. NOTA: el fabricante discute que esto sea una vulnerabilidad, indicando que "ya ha sido mitigado por el firewall interno que limita el acceso a los servicios de configuración del localhost".
